alert.note: Alert for Clark; Lincoln (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 8:52PM PDT until September 01 at 10:15PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LINCOLN AND NORTH CENTRAL CLARK COUNTIES... At 852 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain were moving out of north central Clark and into Lincoln County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen along Highway 93 near Coyote Springs and along State Route 168 to Moapa. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Highway 93 near Coyote Springs, Sr 168 Mile Marker 21, and Moapa Town. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
